ocr_qa.question: What is the sheet title printed in the title block?
ocr_qa.answer: Proposed Main Building Section Typical Entrance
evidence: The title block lists the sheet title as 'Proposed Main Building Section Typical Entrance'.

ocr_qa.question: What sheet number is shown for this drawing?
evidence: The bottom-right of the title block shows the sheet number 'P-10.00'.

ocr_qa.question: What is the drawing scale indicated in the title block?
What is the project number written in the title block?
evidence: '1858' is printed under the project number in the title block.

ocr_qa.question: What is the elevation of the top of the penthouse?
evidence: 'El. +237'-4"' is printed as the top elevation of the penthouse.

spatial_qa.question: Where are the Mechanical Spaces located relative to the central elevator shaft?
spatial_qa.answer: They are located directly to the left and right of the elevator shaft, near the roof.
evidence: The drawing labels 'Mechanical Space' on both sides of the elevator shaft under the sloped roof.

spatial_qa.question: Is the section view a complete symmetrical view along the elevator shaft?
spatial_qa.answer: No, it is not a complete symmetrical view along the elevator shaft.
evidence: The section view is not a complete symmetrical view along the elevator shaft.

counting_qa.question: How many vertical circulation elements are shown in the section?
counting_qa.answer: Two stairwells and one central elevator shaft.
evidence: The section clearly labels two 'Stairwell' areas on the left and right sides and one 'Elevator Shaft' in the center.

counting_qa.question: How many lobby levels are visible in the section?
evidence: The word 'Lobby' appears six times vertically on each side of the elevator shaft.

counting_qa.question: How many parking levels are visible below grade?
evidence: Two levels labeled 'Parking' appear beneath the grade line.

counting_qa.question: How many consulting firms are included on this floor plan?
evidence: Foster + Partners, Arup, OLIN, KIER & WRIGHT, and alta

comparison_qa.question: Which side of the elevator shaft has more stairwell? Left or right?
evidence: The right side has more stairwell.
